changed_products.title: For the love of Bees Gift Pack

description:
Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains;

  
 * The Bee Barn 
 * Natural Nesting Hay 
 * A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds 
 * Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees 
 * Lovingly packed in our Gift Box  Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain.

 Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds.

 Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees.

 This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

description:
Learning Resources Design & Drill Bolt-It Bucket helps kids learn construction and STEM skills on-the-go.

 This construction toy set can be used to build STEM skills through hands-on play both at home and as a travel set, with a built-in drilling board lid on top of a bucket packed with brightly-coloured bolts. Simply use the included toy power drill to attach the bolts to the lid, either using the included, easy-to-follow designs or creating your own! The bolts come in four bright colours, helping to teach colour recognition, while the drill has a chunky design, making it easy for little hands to use and develop spatial perception, hand-eye coordination and fine motor skills. All pieces can be stored inside the bucket for easy tidy-up.

title: My First Coding and Robotics
My First Coding and Robotics: Build & Code Fun Robots, Easy Card Programming for Kids Ages 4-8, No Computer Needed STEM Learning Toy
description:
My First Coding and Robotics is a brilliant starter kit to teach coding principles with a cute little robot. You don’t need a tablet, smartphone, or computer to program this robot; programs are created by simply laying down a sequence of physical code cards.

 As the robot drives over the code cards, an Optical identifier sensor or optical scanner on the bottom of the robot, reads the code cards one by one and loads the program. Next, place the robot on a grid made of map cards, and the robot runs the program. You can program the robot to move in different directions, activate its output gear, light up its LED, play sounds, and respond to different function cards. The integrated output gear makes it possible to build simple robotic creations with arms or other moving parts that respond according to the program’s instructions.

 This robot kit also teaches physical engineering and problem solving skills through a series of building and coding lessons. The 30 lessons are aligned with standards for computer science education developed by the Computer Science Teachers Association (CSTA) and the International Society for Technology (ISTE) Education, as well as courses from Code.org.

 The lessons or activities progress in complexity through the illustrated manual, allowing the kit to be appropriate for a child as young as four years with help from an adult and as old as eight years. The lessons cover these six key areas in coding: sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, functions, and variables.

 In addition to Sammy (the robot), there are five other stories, each with a series of model-building and coding challenges and lessons related to it: a mouse moves through a maze to find cheese; a penguin wanders around a zoo; a soccer player moves a ball into the goal; a fire truck puts out a fire; and a factory robot performs tasks in a factory scene. A full-colour illustrated manual guides (https://www.thamesandkosmos.com/manuals/full/567012_Kids-First-Coding&Robotics-Manual.pdf) users through the coding lessons and the assembly of the different models.

 Requires 3 AA batteries, supplied separately.

 Ages 4 to 8 years.

My First Coding and Robotics Kit: A Fun Journey into Programming and Engineering! Get ready for an exciting adventure into the world of coding and robotics with the My First Coding and Robotics Kit! This fantastic set is designed to introduce young minds, ages 4 to 8, to the fundamentals of programming in a super engaging and hands-on way. Forget about needing screens or complex devices; this kit uses clever physical code cards that your adorable robot pal, Sammy, reads with its special optical identifier sensor on its underside. Simply lay out a sequence of these code cards, and watch as Sammy understands its mission! Once programmed, place Sammy on a grid made of map cards, and get ready to see your creations come to life! Sammy can be programmed to zoom in different directions, activate its integrated output gear for fun moving parts like arms, flash its colorful LED lights, and even play cheerful sounds. The possibilities are endless as your child learns to think like a programmer and an engineer. The built-in output gear is a game-changer, allowing kids to build simple robotic creations that respond to their coded commands, fostering creativity and a sense of accomplishment. This kit is more than just play; it's a brilliant introduction to physical engineering and essential problem-solving skills through a series of progressively challenging building and coding lessons. These 30 illustrated lessons are expertly crafted and aligned with important computer science education standards from organizations like CSTA and ISTE, and even courses from Code.org, ensuring a valuable learning experience. The full-color illustrated manual, which can be accessed online for convenience, provides step-by-step guidance for both coding lessons and model assembly, making it perfect for adult-child collaboration or independent exploration for older kids. The lessons cleverly cover six key coding areas: sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, functions, and variables, all presented in a way that feels like fun and discovery. Sammy isn't the only star; the kit includes five other engaging stories with related model-building and coding challenges. Imagine a mouse navigating a maze to find cheese, a penguin exploring a zoo, a soccer player scoring a goal, a fire truck bravely putting out a blaze, or a factory robot efficiently completing its tasks. Each scenario provides a unique context for applying learned coding concepts. To power Sammy's adventures, you'll need 3 AA batteries, which are conveniently supplied separately. This kit truly makes learning about technology an enjoyable and accessible experience for the whole family.

Develop children’s fine motor skills and dexterity as they explore each different component. Undo a lock, latch or zip anywhere on the board as the hidden scenes are unveiled underneath.

 Little fingers can lift the elastic from the buttons on the clouds, unzip the orange tent, lift the latch of the metal lock buckle on the grey house, unclip the buckle on the barn, undo the belt buckle on the yellow house, and open the leather pouch on the purple house.

 A fun, sensory way to build fine motor skills and basic life skills (zipping up clothes, putting on belts etc) as well as encourage language development and discussion. Suitable for 2+ years.

 Lifeskills Board - product features:

  
 * Develops fine motor skills and dexterity 
 * High quality materials 
 * Encourage life skills practice 
 * 2+ years

description_changes.title: For the love of Bees Gift Pack

description:
Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains;

  
 * The Bee Barn 
 * Natural Nesting Hay 
 * A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds 
 * Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees 
 * Lovingly packed in our Gift Box  Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain.

 Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds.

 Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees.

 This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

description: Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work. This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations! Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits. description_changes.title: My First Coding and Robotics: Build & Code Fun Robots, Easy Card Programming for Kids Ages 4-8, No Computer Needed STEM Learning Toy

title: My First Coding and Robotics
My First Coding and Robotics: Build & Code Fun Robots, Easy Card Programming for Kids Ages 4-8, No Computer Needed STEM Learning Toy
description:
My First Coding and Robotics is a brilliant starter kit to teach coding principles with a cute little robot. You don’t need a tablet, smartphone, or computer to program this robot; programs are created by simply laying down a sequence of physical code cards.

 As the robot drives over the code cards, an Optical identifier sensor or optical scanner on the bottom of the robot, reads the code cards one by one and loads the program. Next, place the robot on a grid made of map cards, and the robot runs the program. You can program the robot to move in different directions, activate its output gear, light up its LED, play sounds, and respond to different function cards. The integrated output gear makes it possible to build simple robotic creations with arms or other moving parts that respond according to the program’s instructions.

 This robot kit also teaches physical engineering and problem solving skills through a series of building and coding lessons. The 30 lessons are aligned with standards for computer science education developed by the Computer Science Teachers Association (CSTA) and the International Society for Technology (ISTE) Education, as well as courses from Code.org.

 The lessons or activities progress in complexity through the illustrated manual, allowing the kit to be appropriate for a child as young as four years with help from an adult and as old as eight years. The lessons cover these six key areas in coding: sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, functions, and variables.

 In addition to Sammy (the robot), there are five other stories, each with a series of model-building and coding challenges and lessons related to it: a mouse moves through a maze to find cheese; a penguin wanders around a zoo; a soccer player moves a ball into the goal; a fire truck puts out a fire; and a factory robot performs tasks in a factory scene. A full-colour illustrated manual guides (https://www.thamesandkosmos.com/manuals/full/567012_Kids-First-Coding&Robotics-Manual.pdf) users through the coding lessons and the assembly of the different models.

 Requires 3 AA batteries, supplied separately.

 Ages 4 to 8 years.

My First Coding and Robotics Kit: A Fun Journey into Programming and Engineering! Get ready for an exciting adventure into the world of coding and robotics with the My First Coding and Robotics Kit! This fantastic set is designed to introduce young minds, ages 4 to 8, to the fundamentals of programming in a super engaging and hands-on way. Forget about needing screens or complex devices; this kit uses clever physical code cards that your adorable robot pal, Sammy, reads with its special optical identifier sensor on its underside. Simply lay out a sequence of these code cards, and watch as Sammy understands its mission! Once programmed, place Sammy on a grid made of map cards, and get ready to see your creations come to life! Sammy can be programmed to zoom in different directions, activate its integrated output gear for fun moving parts like arms, flash its colorful LED lights, and even play cheerful sounds. The possibilities are endless as your child learns to think like a programmer and an engineer. The built-in output gear is a game-changer, allowing kids to build simple robotic creations that respond to their coded commands, fostering creativity and a sense of accomplishment. This kit is more than just play; it's a brilliant introduction to physical engineering and essential problem-solving skills through a series of progressively challenging building and coding lessons. These 30 illustrated lessons are expertly crafted and aligned with important computer science education standards from organizations like CSTA and ISTE, and even courses from Code.org, ensuring a valuable learning experience. The full-color illustrated manual, which can be accessed online for convenience, provides step-by-step guidance for both coding lessons and model assembly, making it perfect for adult-child collaboration or independent exploration for older kids. The lessons cleverly cover six key coding areas: sequencing, loops, events, conditionals, functions, and variables, all presented in a way that feels like fun and discovery. Sammy isn't the only star; the kit includes five other engaging stories with related model-building and coding challenges. Imagine a mouse navigating a maze to find cheese, a penguin exploring a zoo, a soccer player scoring a goal, a fire truck bravely putting out a blaze, or a factory robot efficiently completing its tasks. Each scenario provides a unique context for applying learned coding concepts. To power Sammy's adventures, you'll need 3 AA batteries, which are conveniently supplied separately. This kit truly makes learning about technology an enjoyable and accessible experience for the whole family.

image_changes.title: For the love of Bees Gift Pack

description:
Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains;

  
 * The Bee Barn 
 * Natural Nesting Hay 
 * A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds 
 * Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees 
 * Lovingly packed in our Gift Box  Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain.

 Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds.

 Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees.

 This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

description:
Build a Bee Hotel Gift in a Tin from Apples to Pears lets you set up somewhere to stay for your garden visitors!

 Use this easy-to-build kit to create a home for solitary bees and other insects. It's fascinating to watch them go about their lives in something you've created! This set is great for beginners, with simple, step-by-step instructions and all the pieces you need. It also encourages children to learn about bees using the spotter sheet provided, meaning this set continues to be a fantastic educational tool long after the hotel has been completed! All pieces store neatly inside the tin to prevent mess.

 Educational Benefits of Build a Bee Hotel Gift in a Tin

  
 * Discovering the World. 
 * Screen-Free Play.  Contains:

  
 * Pre-sawn, drilled pieces of wood, dowel and wood glue. 
 * Full instructions.  Tin Size: 14 x 10 x 5cm.

 Finished Hotel Size: 9 x 8 x 8cm.

 Age 6+

description: Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work. This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations! Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits. title: Djeco Kumihimo Braiding Bracelets Kit - Celeste: Create beautiful Japanese kumihimo bracelets with colorful threads and charms. For kids aged 8+.
Kumihimo Braiding Bracelets - Celeste
description: Kumihimo Braiding Bracelets - Celeste: Unleash Your Inner Artist and Craft Beautiful Bracelets with the Magical Kumihimo Braiding Kit! Get ready for a creative adventure as you dive into the enchanting world of Japanese kumihimo braiding! This super fun kit is designed for budding crafters aged 8 and up, offering a fantastic way to discover the art of creating intricate and stunning bracelets. Inside this comprehensive kit, you'll find everything you need to embark on this exciting journey. Experience the joy of weaving with the included colorful and sparkly gold threads, which add a touch of glamour and excitement to every design. The heart of this kit is a beautifully crafted braiding tool, perfectly sized to fit little hands, making the process of mastering the kumihimo technique an absolute delight. We've also included a detailed, step-by-step instruction booklet that's a true companion for young artists. This booklet doesn't just explain the techniques; it walks children through each stage of their bracelet-making journey, empowering them to create with confidence and pride. Imagine the smiles as you gift a handmade bracelet to a friend, family member, or even wear your own dazzling creations! With enough materials to make four beautiful bracelets, the possibilities for sharing joy are endless. The kit comes with adorable charms, perfect for adding that extra special personalized touch to your braided masterpieces, allowing for endless customization and imaginative flair. The Celeste edition boasts a delightful color palette, evoking the beauty of the sky and stardust, making each bracelet a unique treasure. This hands-on activity is not only incredibly entertaining but also helps develop fine motor skills, patience, and a wonderful sense of accomplishment. Dive in and let the vibrant threads and traditional artistry transform into wearable works of art you'll be proud to show off. Get ready to braid, decorate, and shine with your own unique Kumihimo bracelets!

Weave pretty bracelets using traditional Japanese kumihimo braiding techniques. A comprehensive kit with a detailed step-by-step instructions booklet to guide children in their creations. A pretty tool for creating the Japanese artform of kumihimo. Charms for decorating bracelets. Coloured and sparkly gold thread. 4 beautiful bracelets to make for yourself or others. Booklet provided that explains techniques and gives step-by-step instructions. Age 8+

description:
Learning Resources Design & Drill Bolt-It Bucket helps kids learn construction and STEM skills on-the-go.

 This construction toy set can be used to build STEM skills through hands-on play both at home and as a travel set, with a built-in drilling board lid on top of a bucket packed with brightly-coloured bolts. Simply use the included toy power drill to attach the bolts to the lid, either using the included, easy-to-follow designs or creating your own! The bolts come in four bright colours, helping to teach colour recognition, while the drill has a chunky design, making it easy for little hands to use and develop spatial perception, hand-eye coordination and fine motor skills. All pieces can be stored inside the bucket for easy tidy-up.

 Educational Benefits of Learning Resources Design & Drill Bolt-It Bucket

  
 * Practical STEM Focus. 
 * Promotes Technology. 
 * Enhances Cognitive Skills. 
 * Fine Motor Skills. 
 * Hand to Eye Coordination. 
 * Creativity. 
 * Colours & Designs. 
 * Shapes.  Contains:

  
 * See-through bucket with activity board lid and handle. 
 * 52 bolts in four different colours. 
 * Toy power drill. 
 * Guide with patterns.  Storage bucket size: 22 x 23cm.

 Drill requires 3 AAA batteries, supplied separately.

 ﻿Ages 3 - 7.

description:
Camper Van Construction Kit in a Tin is a cool construction kit from Apples to Pears that lets you build your very own camper van!

 This metallic craft set comes with easy-to-follow instructions, meaning it is suitable for complete beginners, allowing anyone to make their own camper van. Supplied with all the tools and pieces you need including screwdriver, spanner and instructions, with everything storing neatly in a handy tin for easy tidy-up and fewer missing pieces! item_group_changes.title: For the love of Bees Gift Pack

description:
Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains;

  
 * The Bee Barn 
 * Natural Nesting Hay 
 * A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds 
 * Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees 
 * Lovingly packed in our Gift Box  Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain.

 Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds.

 Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees.

 This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

description: Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work. This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations! Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits. shipping_changes.title: For the love of Bees Gift Pack

description:
Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains;

  
 * The Bee Barn 
 * Natural Nesting Hay 
 * A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds 
 * Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees 
 * Lovingly packed in our Gift Box  Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. The barn also offers shelter and a space to create homes for these creatures in the various sections. This Bee Barn comes in an attractive gift box and is easy to put up and maintain.

 Many other pollinators may nest in the bee barn, but they will require some nesting material. Nesting material can fit in the lower compartment. As they often like to adopt ready-made nests from other creatures, such as birds.

 Secondly, the bundle also contains natural nesting hay for the ‘Bee Barn’. As well as a pack of seeds to grow colourful nectar-rich wildflowers that attract and feed bees. Plus, our latest conservation guide on Bees.

 This Gift Bundle is the perfect gift for your nature-loving friends and family. You’ll be helping them create a cosy home for solitary bees in their gardens and outdoor spaces. Therefore, continuing the much-needed conservation of our friendly pollinators!

description: Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work. This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. description:
Bundled to help the conservation of solitary bees and other pollinators, contains;

  
 * The Bee Barn 
 * Natural Nesting Hay 
 * A pack of nectar-rich Wildflower Seeds 
 * Our latest Conservation Guide on Bees 
 * Lovingly packed in our Gift Box  Firstly, For the love of Bees gift pack contains a charming, customer favourite ‘Bee Barn’. Produced from sustainably managed, wood, with a recycled second-life plastic frontage. Designed to attract, solitary bees and other species of pollinators and insects. description: Grab your tools, it’s time to get building! Learn how to use tools and build your own workbench with this introductory mechanical engineering kit for kids ages three and up. Join Ty and Karlie — the young engineers featured in the other Kids First early engineering kits — to learn how to use a hammer, screwdriver, and wrench, and the basic engineering principles behind how these tools work. This kit features large tools that are comfortable for kids to hold, while also being lightweight and safe. In addition to the workbench, build five other awesome models with the included modular building parts, including a race car, airplane, house, scissors, and a toolbox to carry your tools. Then let your imagination run wild and build your own creations! Intro to Tools & Building is a fun and engaging way to teach simple engineering concepts to young children, allowing parents, teachers, and caregivers to lay the groundwork for strong STEM-related skills and comprehension at an early age. Model building helps develop fine motor skills, mechanical engineering skills, visual-spatial skills, and reasoning and concept development skills. The parts in this kit are compatible with the parts of other Thames & Kosmos Kids First engineering kits. description: Kumihimo Braiding Bracelets - Celeste: Unleash Your Inner Artist and Craft Beautiful Bracelets with the Magical Kumihimo Braiding Kit! Get ready for a creative adventure as you dive into the enchanting world of Japanese kumihimo braiding! This super fun kit is designed for budding crafters aged 8 and up, offering a fantastic way to discover the art of creating intricate and stunning bracelets. Inside this comprehensive kit, you'll find everything you need to embark on this exciting journey. Experience the joy of weaving with the included colorful and sparkly gold threads, which add a touch of glamour and excitement to every design. The heart of this kit is a beautifully crafted braiding tool, perfectly sized to fit little hands, making the process of mastering the kumihimo technique an absolute delight. We've also included a detailed, step-by-step instruction booklet that's a true companion for young artists. This booklet doesn't just explain the techniques; it walks children through each stage of their bracelet-making journey, empowering them to create with confidence and pride. Imagine the smiles as you gift a handmade bracelet to a friend, family member, or even wear your own dazzling creations! With enough materials to make four beautiful bracelets, the possibilities for sharing joy are endless. The kit comes with adorable charms, perfect for adding that extra special personalized touch to your braided masterpieces, allowing for endless customization and imaginative flair. The Celeste edition boasts a delightful color palette, evoking the beauty of the sky and stardust, making each bracelet a unique treasure. This hands-on activity is not only incredibly entertaining but also helps develop fine motor skills, patience, and a wonderful sense of accomplishment. Dive in and let the vibrant threads and traditional artistry transform into wearable works of art you'll be proud to show off. Get ready to braid, decorate, and shine with your own unique Kumihimo bracelets!

Weave pretty bracelets using traditional Japanese kumihimo braiding techniques. A comprehensive kit with a detailed step-by-step instructions booklet to guide children in their creations. A pretty tool for creating the Japanese artform of kumihimo. Charms for decorating bracelets. Coloured and sparkly gold thread. 4 beautiful bracelets to make for yourself or others. Booklet provided that explains techniques and gives step-by-step instructions. Age 8+

description:
Learning Resources Design & Drill Bolt-It Bucket helps kids learn construction and STEM skills on-the-go.

 This construction toy set can be used to build STEM skills through hands-on play both at home and as a travel set, with a built-in drilling board lid on top of a bucket packed with brightly-coloured bolts. Simply use the included toy power drill to attach the bolts to the lid, either using the included, easy-to-follow designs or creating your own! The bolts come in four bright colours, helping to teach colour recognition, while the drill has a chunky design, making it easy for little hands to use and develop spatial perception, hand-eye coordination and fine motor skills. All pieces can be stored inside the bucket for easy tidy-up.

 Educational Benefits of Learning Resources Design & Drill Bolt-It Bucket

  
 * Practical STEM Focus. 
 * Promotes Technology. 
 * Enhances Cognitive Skills. 
 * Fine Motor Skills. 
 * Hand to Eye Coordination. 
 * Creativity. 
 * Colours & Designs. 
 * Shapes.  Contains:

  
 * See-through bucket with activity board lid and handle. 
 * 52 bolts in four different colours. 
 * Toy power drill. 
 * Guide with patterns.  Storage bucket size: 22 x 23cm.

 Drill requires 3 AAA batteries, supplied separately.

 ﻿Ages 3 - 7.

description:
Develop children’s fine motor skills and dexterity as they explore each different component. Undo a lock, latch or zip anywhere on the board as the hidden scenes are unveiled underneath.

 Little fingers can lift the elastic from the buttons on the clouds, unzip the orange tent, lift the latch of the metal lock buckle on the grey house, unclip the buckle on the barn, undo the belt buckle on the yellow house, and open the leather pouch on the purple house.

 A fun, sensory way to build fine motor skills and basic life skills (zipping up clothes, putting on belts etc) as well as encourage language development and discussion. Suitable for 2+ years.

 * Develops fine motor skills and dexterity

 * 2+ years
